history.content:
Yes, you should be. (I was hired as a reader the semester after I took the course)  I think that hiring decisions for readers aren't done until after grades come out anyways, but don't quote me on that.

Just an FYI, while 70 has an application for both readers and tutors, there are (at least in past semesters) actually only reader positions.  So if you want to be a "tutor", you should fill out the reader application, then ask for the mixed reading / tutoring option if you get hired.

children.subject:
Definitely do apply!  With lab assisting experience, you have more experience that I did when I applied :P

Also keep in mind that if you don't get a reader position but still want to be involved with 70, you can be an academic intern (which is sorta similar to lab assistants in 61-series classes).

Great! So if I just had experience lab-assisting for 61A, would you say I have a fair shot?

Used to tutor in high school and I really enjoy 70 material, so I'm hoping the lack of official teaching experience doesn't drag me back!
It appears that the app is already open at https://willow.coe.berkeley.edu/PHP/gsiapp/menu.php, though I haven't seen an announcement for it, so I don't know when the deadline is.
Yeah I'm also really looking to get involved with CS70 in the fall - I'm currently taking it also. Is the application already out? If not, approximately when will it come out?

history.content: Hey, I'm currently enrolled in CS70, and I might want to apply to be a reader/tutor/eventually TA for it for this Fall 2017. Would I be considered, seeing that grades only come out 3 weeks after term ends?
history.subject: Quick Question about Hiring for Fall 2017
